intro: Canthium coronatum, commonly known as the crowned spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and southern Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, yellowish flowers that are surrounded by colorful bracts. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough, hairy texture. Canthium coronatum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
